thread.title: Tag Heuer offers a first look at its Android Wear smartwatch - Tech
thread.title_full: Tag Heuer offers a first look at its Android Wear smartwatch - Tech News - Digital Spy

author: Mark Langshaw
title: Tag Heuer offers a first look at its Android Wear smartwatch - Tech
text: Tag Heuer has offered a first look at its upcoming Android Wear smartwatch, albeit shrouded in shadow.The luxury timepiece firm shared an obscured image of the Tag Heuer Connected on its social media accounts, with only a side button and minute markers visible. © Tag Heuer Although the teaser image isn't giving much away, the Swiss firm has already revealed details about its Android Wear debut, including pricing and battery life.The device will be the most expensive wearable with Google innards, landing on the market at $1,800 (around £1,172), but offers impressive battery life of up to 40 hours.By comparison, the current most expensive Android Wear device is the Huawei Watch, priced at $799 (around £515), and the Connected will cost more than every model of the Apple Watch, bar the high-end editions.Tag Heuer will unveil the Connected at a press conference in New York City on November 9.
